Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull place”
Reviews.Author: Trip36
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel the real local experience, this is your place. Out of fast tourists and their noise. In the middle of a reseidencial neighborhood but close of a subway. With a lot of good restaurants and stores around. You can take your breakfast there like a hotel (payng an extra tax) or you can buy products in supermarkets (two in the same block) and made by yourself at your room. Full kitchen inside. It´s safe, clean and cheap. It´s here....

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Emac1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideally located near to the Fontana metro stop. You are also within walking distance of all the main attractions. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were clean and nicely decorated. We stayed in a comfort room which faced the courtyard. It had a kitchenette which was very useful and you also had a free safe. The bathroom was nice and had a power shower. They provided toiletries and basics for washing up etc.....I would recommend asking to face the courtyard as the street itself isn't so pretty. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It was a great base to visit the rest of Barcelona from. Thank you to all who recommended it on TA!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Outstanding Value Barcelona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard J L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 day in april, the staff were very helpful with outstanding service, rooms are very tastefully decorated. Hotel is very central to access all Barcelona has to over. Would not hesitate in booking this Hotel again. Top marks.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Aparthotel Silver!”
Reviews.Author: TimDeGroot
Reviews.Content: Good location, just 2 stops with the metro and you are at the Ramblas from Fontana. The hotel was clean and the fridge in your room is nice for a couple of beers or a bottle of water. There is a little supermarket just around the corner. Breakfast is 8 euros, but don't expect to much of it, rather have breakfast downtown. Overall we had a great stay at Aparthotel Silver.

Reviews.Title: “Your base to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: Caminhante
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so close to the Fontana metro stop that it will be very easy for you to explore the many possibilities of Barcelona. The Gracia neighborhood is very lively, and you will have the opportunity to stroll like a local, shop in street stores, have a coffee and so on. Talking about the hotel itself, the staff is extremely friendly and I found the breakfast to be pretty decent. The rooms are Barcelona- (and Europe-, in general) style: tiny. But overall they do the job: you've a got a bed, a desk for your computer, fast (although sometimes spotty) Wi-Fi connection, shower, etc. There are a few cons however: you will need to find out by yourself the trick to position the shower facing the middle, not the walls; the bed is far from comfortable; and walls are paper-thin. My roommate and I were frequently reminded of our neighbor every day at 5:30am when he would call home; and every night we he would start snoring.

Reviews.Title: “Great location cuts both ways”
Reviews.Author: Morpheus1041
Reviews.Content: First, the location of this property is awesome - right near the Fontana metro stop in the heart of a cool neighborhood. The hotel itself is a little dated without too much in terms of amenities. Our first room was insufferably hot, with no air conditioning. We were moved to a different room for the rest of our stay, but being off the main road, it was very noisy especially at 4am when the trash was collected. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful, but the cleaning staff had a bad habit of entering without knocking, even when the Do Not Disturb sign was out. The breakfast buffet for 8 euros was okay, but not great. So, a mixed bag, but with a white noise maker ( for us an iPad on a rain loop) it worked perfectly well.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION & VALUE FOR MONEY.”
Reviews.Author: brendobrendo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the heart of Gracia, with Fontana metro station 200mtrs away (Barcelona's metro is so easy to use ), and a leisurely 25min walk to Placa Catalunya and tourist central. Hotel staff were very courteous and friendly, room's were spic + span on a daily basis , and it being a week long stay over the christmas period, we were surprised with a free bottle of Cava and chocolate's on christmas day, and hand written christmas greetings in a multitude of languages. A nice touch. The kitchenette was very useful, a proper sized fridge, kitchen sink and a couple of hot-plates and a microwave were all very handy and gave it the feel of a studio rather than a hotel room. Room size was not terribly big, but ample. All in all, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: moominmoggy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in August 2011. It was a surprise trip with my partner, my sister and I arriving first with my parents arriving after us. We were booked as one whole group so let the receptionist know and she was fantastic at keeping the secret when our parents later checked in! Every member of staff was friendly and made the atmosphere pleasant. Rooms were very clean and worth paying a little extra for the balcony-complete with astroturf which we loved! The kitchenette area was great too-nice just to make our own tea/coffee at breakfast and store bottled water. Free computer&printer downstairs also helped as we good pre book tickets/vouchers that we discovered during the week. Our room was quiet and the hotel is a great location. Seconds away from a supermarket and metro station. Getting the ten trip ticket is great value and saves hassle with tickets too-and the ten trip ticket can be shared across a party! Only a short metro trip into the centre of Barcelona. We only had breakfast on the last day-it was ok, exactly what we expected and no more expensive than having breakfast anywhere else in the city. Would definitely stay again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: flipper50000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon before a cruise. Everyone was very nice, they gave us some champagne and upgraded our room. Close to the subway, but still in a nice quiet neighborhood. Very convenient for seeing the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: filoxeniaGreece
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at Silver.We chose the hotel based on other tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. The place is excellently located,you have the possibility to make your own breakfast everyday and it is really great value for money. The only drawback is the fact that it is so quiet that if the resident next door snores...you hear it loud and clear. Other than that it was a great stay

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Vabrant
Reviews.Content: Been staying at Silver frequently since 2008. Located in the heart Gracia, 5 minutes away form the subway station. Great service, great prices, Could say Silver is "my place" when in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: koulouraki
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for about 4 days in October. We could not have asked for a better place. The location was perfect - one block from the metro and there were many cute little stores and cafes within walking distance. We did not opt for the breakfast since we found it to be a bit pricey, especially with all the cafes so close. We wanted to experience the city and be able to travel quick and easy. Most importantnly we didn't want to be in a noisy/touristy area...we found this to be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: upstatewanderer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aparthotel silver for a week. The location is uptown near Gracia which is a great little neighborhood with lots of small plazas and outdoor cafes, 3 stops away from Las Ramblas and all the tourists. Beautiful terrace, great beds, very clean and friendly service. We got a special price because they are doing renovations. Would definitely recommend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great place - enjoy!”
Reviews.Author: perubaby
Reviews.Content: We stayed in October for a few days. It is very close to the Fontana metro. If you are staying for a couple of days, buy a T10 ticket fr (I think) $8.25 which gives you 10 journeys on any public transport -bus train and metro.you can use it for more than 1 person, so a couple only need to buy one and you can take 5 journeys each. It is in a lovely district, away from the hordes, with lots of interesting architecture. It also had some lovely local bakery and deli shops.We had a lovely room, with kitchenette and large balcony. We had everything we needed in the kitchen. The breakfast area was nice, we sat outside in the garden. Breakfast was $8. you could go out and get something locally, but breakfasts are generally just coffee and pastry. if you like fruit or cereal or cheese / meats (or all of it), you are better off paying for breakfast here. The staff are all friendly and helpful, and there is wi fi in reception. we really enjoyed our stay here

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: viajera2000_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Aparthotel Silver from April 20 to April 30 2011. Couldn´t have been better. Good location (not in the middle of the Ramblas but nice 15 minutes walk along Carrer de Gracia). And just a block from the metro line 10 which takes you everywhere!. The room was spacious, with convenient microwave and kitchen utensils. Friendly staff at reception desk, internet access in the lobby. The bathroom very small, but very clean (as well as the rest of the room). Could improve: may be some more utensils in the mini kitchen area (some more spoons for instance). But all in all, good value for the money. When you come back after walking and walking and walking in beautiful Barcelona, you feel like coming back home!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a budget stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Aoife_ireland100
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the most basic room and we couldn't ask for anything more. While we probaly got the worst room in the hotel(beside the cafeteria) it was fine as we didn't intend on staying long in the room. Lovely little touches such as the chocolates in the room, great kitchenette complete with washing up facilities to the handy handkerchiefs boxed so you could bring them with you. It was great for the price and although we did not have breakfast here it was only 8euro, not bad at all for Barcelona. Barcelona is a beautiful city and staying in Gracia, where Silver is located allows you to take in a bit of the real Barcelona and mingle with the locals at the evening markets. Definetly would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced aparthotel”
Reviews.Author: MizenHead64
Reviews.Content: This budget hotel is 2 min. from Fontana metro station, a good 3 star place with fine breakfast. Our room was facing to the street side, be careful summertime when windows are open during the night it is quite noisy until Spanish people go to sleep (around 1 a.m. ).But if you want more quiet room book on the courtiyard side. Plenty of deals such as free WIFI, plus 2 computers in the lobby, elevator, friendly staff with good English, luggage storage facility. Surrounding streets seemed to be safe for walking. Valuable kitchenette in the room, where you can prepare coffee , tea, food etc. Cleaning staff in our room was not on their top of quality at all. Nevertheless for 71 Eur per room , plus 8 Eur pp for breakfast is not a bad price in Barcelona so such location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a quiet part of the city”
Reviews.Author: thetravelbug49
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Aparthotel Silver and liked everything about it. The location is amazing...a short metro ride into the city or the beach and just a block away from the hotel. We felt safe and liked the fact it wasn't in the middle of the busy downtown area. We had a room on the top floor with a deck, which was so great to sit out on in the evenings with a glass of wine. We found the room spacious and clean with everything we needed. The continental breakfasts were also pretty good and it was nice to sit outside in the mornings to enjoy it. Be forewarned not to take anything out of the breakfast room back to your hotel room however...they will double charge you. All in all...we found this hotel met our needs and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby!”
Reviews.Author: Annon1969
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for medicle treatment and really wanted a quiet clean hotel, this one was shabby, the curtains dirty and whilst we were out all day and looking forward to coming back and resting in a clean room , no one even came in and cleaned! There was a vent which flapped all night and we paid extra for what was supposed to be the best room! Also on a minor point the only English chenel was bbc news which repeats every hour or so - no good when you need to relax and rest.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: patsyc216
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Having been to Barcelona on several occasions and have always stayed quite centrally in standard hotels, we decided we wanted some different. Aparthotel Silver fit the bill exactly: smallish hotel away from the hustle and bustle, but only 2 – 3 stop away on Metro, 3 local markets within walking distance, our own little kitchen, nice neighbourhood totally different to the Barcelona we are familiar with. Room was a good size, with modern décor and always clean. I don't usually sleep well on holiday, but the bed was of just the right firmness and the location of the hotel was quiet, so I had 3 very good nights sleep. The kitchenette, although small, had all the equipment we needed to cook 3 dinners and 3 breakfasts. Apart from olive oil and salt and pepper, they even prepared a sealed packed containing washing up liquid and towels! We didn’t have enough pans to cook one of our meals (yes, we cooked proper meals in the room!) and after a quick call to reception a pan was delivered to our room within minutes. Reception staff always friendly and helpful. We had a late flight and they were more than happy to store our luggage for us after check out. On the topic of markets, we would highly recommend the newly refurbished Mercat Llibertat, only 5 minutes walk away from the hotel. Clean, bright and airy, it looked more like a supermarket or shopping centre than a food market. It also has a supermarket attached. As for food recommendations, our best lunch was eaten at Wok Yutaka II near Sagrada Família. An Asian buffet with so much choice, good quality and great value. DH loved all the fresh seafood on offer. Oysters, razor clams, lobster, king prawns, the list goes on and on... Followed next by En Ville near Boqueira. We love Barcelona, always have. This hotel has given us even more reason to visit Barcelona again!

Reviews.Title: “Silver”
Reviews.Author: girltvl
Reviews.Content: This was a Very Nice fairly inexpensive hotel for Barcelona. Location is 1/2 block from metro. Staff was VERY friendly and helpful. Room were clean and beds comfortable. Not fancy but had basics and roomier than most. Shower is a bit small but in europe that is normal. Plenty of hot water. Hotel has a nice community patio area. We had drinks each night. Staff had great reccomendations for restaurants. WhenI go back to Barcelona I will try and stay at Silver Aparthotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cute neighborhood, nice, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: RPMTravels23
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Barcelona and I could not have asked for a better hotel. First, the hotel is located literally footsteps from the Fontana metro, which is so crucial when you are a tourist trying to get around and see places. Secondly, the hotel is in the neighborhood of Gracia, which in my opinion, is the ideal location to stay. If you are looking for a non-touristy retreat after being a tourist all day long then this is the place the for you! My favorite part about Gracia was its two plazas, Plaza Del Sol and Plaza Dominica, which were just a few minutes walk away. Both plazas have good, cheap places to eat and they are packed with people enjoying, relaxing, eating, drinking, talking ... the epitome of Spanish culture. Don't miss out! Lastly, the rooms were clean, compact, and modern and staff nice and helpful. We only had two issues during our stay ... #1, one of the outlets in the bathroom was not working, which made it hard for me to blowdry, etc ... I could have probably asked them to change our rooms but we had already settled and I didn't bother. #2, the front door is automatic and somehow the sensor was not working and hit my poor husband in the side of his head on our way out one day ... hopefuly they fixed it! ONe more tip ... don't bother getting their expensive breakfast.. there are plenty of cute markets/stores right outside the hotel and we just picked up some toast, jam, butter, croissants, oj etc and we had great breakfasts in our hotel. P.s- the hotel room comes equipped with a stove, microwave and all utensils! I would highly recommend a stay here ... I can't wait to come back :)

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, good price”
Reviews.Author: TheFlickGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Silver and found it to be everything we needed. It's located in the Gracia zone which is a residential area not far from the core. The Fontana metro stop is conveniently located at the end of the street. We stayed in a "comfort room" which had been recently renovated and it was spacious and comfortable. The kitchenette is hidden behind a pair of folding doors and includes a fridge, microwave, induction cooktop and some basic cookware. To maximize space the dining table folds flat against the wall until needed. Very nice bars, restaurants and plazas nearby to hang out at. The Rebost de la Plana is about two blocks away and it was the best dinner we had during our whole time in Barcelona - highly recommended! The only minus we could find was that it appeared the cleaning staff relied too much on the previous guest to do a thorough job of cleaning the dinnerware. Otherwise the staff was very friendly and helpful. On balance, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it as a good home base.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franr123
Reviews.Content: Our family had 2 rooms for 3 nights prior to a cruise. Rooms were absolutely the cleanest hotel rooms I've found. Location was perfect for us to visit Barcelona. Very short walk to Fontana Metro. Also small city bus ran right in front of the hotel. Good restaurants near by. Staff at hotel were great and spoke very good english. Little bar by outdoor terrace was nice for cocktail before dinner. Would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ploppyplop
Reviews.Content: We took a taxi from Plaza Catalunya after getting off the aerobus. Easy to find. It's a cosy hotel in the Gracia district and only 3mins walk to Fontana metro station, a good line to be on to see major sights in Barcelona. We stayed in a room facing the courtyard and it was very quiet. It was raining one day and the free loan umbrellas in the lobby were useful. And the free wifi in the room was great. It's very popular so be sure to book ahead. Also, there's this great place for food near the hotel on 33 Carrer d'Astúries called "SMS Delicies". The veal steak & Patatas Barvas were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Good base”
Reviews.Author: luridone
Reviews.Content: Room is clean and well-furnished, the kitchenette is small but functional, adequate A/C. The location is very good - Gracia is quiet and a real neighborhood, lots of good restaurants within easy walking. Excellent walking and Metro access to most of Barcelona's points of interest. Staff is professional, courteous, and very helpful. The breakfast buffet is not worth the 8 euro on its own, but the convenience and pleasant eating area added value. Very reasonable room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Aparthotel”
Reviews.Author: RLY_10
Reviews.Content: The room has a small useful kitchen, large TV. The location is very close to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Better than first glance and great value.”
Reviews.Author: Garybatz
Reviews.Content: Just finished a four night stay. A first look the room was quite dated and tired, but over the course of my stay the good parts shone. The room actually was fine for one person, had a clever kitchenette and was very clean. Housekeeping, towels etc were very good. I was surprised at the number of little details for the price. Excellent free wifi, plus free PCs at reception (one with printer connected). Complimentary city map. Nice bathroom supplies. 24 hour reception, free luggage storage, spoke English. Free in-room safe. Close to metro station not far from city centre. Location is a nice residential area with plenty of shops, supermarkets, places to eat etc. Got a great price via Tripadvisor. Would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT! Just Great!”
Reviews.Author: live2travel4ever
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this hotel. The staff were so nice and professional! They were very helpful as to show us how to get around and where to go! The room was a good size. Amenities were more than enough! For the price you pay, you get a really good deal. We stayed there for 5 days! Location is perfect. Metro station is literally a few steps away. Walking distance to many great places in Barca (e.g. La Pedrera, Casa Batllo, La Rambla, Passeig de Gràcia, lots of stores and restaurants). They clean the rooms regularly! The neighborhood is safe! Also, the first building desinged by Gaudi is in the next alley, right behind the hotel! Over all, we had a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quite okay”
Reviews.Author: bondageluvr
Reviews.Content: Great value for money, I can tell you that. We stayed in the most basic room - no renovations and ground floor but it was very nice. Quite cold at night and the floors were freezing plus the breakfast waitress started banging dishes around in the wee hours of the morning and she wasn't very pleasant, but overall for the money we paid, we got good enough service. Nice for a 2-night stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect mid-Priced Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Jabbers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Aparthotel Silver quite a few times in the last 13 years. Our first visit was in 1998 and the upgrades since then have been wonderful. We like the kitchenette where we can make our own breakfast with items purchased close by. The Metro is just down the street, making it easy to get almost anywhere. The staff has always been "the best" and because this is a family business, it has always been the exact same staff that greets us and helps us with any questions. We highly recommend the Aparthotel Siver!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for city trip”
Reviews.Author: HeinoSchaght
Reviews.Content: Good Next to subway Nice neighbourhood, many restaurants and bars Friendly staff Bad Little bit noisy in the early morning

Reviews.Title: “A home in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: melida27
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was our last stop in our European vacation and we're so glad we ended it in Aparhotel Silver! The staff at the hotel were so nice and the room was fantastic! The hotel is located in a quiet street, so we weren't bothered by the sound of traffic. It is not in a very touristic part of Barcelona, but there is a metro station at the end of the street. We opted to walk to most of the main attractions, like to Gaudi's Casa Mila and Casa Batllo. Barcelona is a lovely city to walk. There is so much to see! It rained most of the time we were there, but the hotel has complimentary umbrellas. The hotel was like a little studio apartment. with a kitchenette and dishes in the cabinets. It even had a nice stereo system! The staff made complimentary copies of our passports for us to keep in case anything happened to ours. They also provided us with city, bus, and metro maps. We got to enjoy exploring Barcelona without worrying about our personal belongings in the hotel. I loved Barcelona and absolutely loved this hotel! If I get the chance to return, I will definitely stay at Aparthotel Silver!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic,would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: saza77
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a stay here and would like to say how friendly and helpful everybody was.Nothing was too much trouble. The entire hotel was clean and tidy and well maintained.Our room was lovely, modern,bright and clean (we stayed in a comfort room with terrace which was lovely as we stayed for 5 nights)and they had thought of all the little extras you might need (washing up liquid,salt and pepper sachets) When out housekeeping came and left the room immaculate. The location of the hotel was fantastic,about 1 minute from the metro but also walking distance to many other tourist areas in a really nice part of Barcelona.Everything you need is on your doorstep.I would highly recommend Aparthotel Silver

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kittley21
Reviews.Content: Staff - very friendly and helpful Room - comfortable,clean,towels were changed everyday,excellent window blackout shutter for a good night's sleep Location - Situated about 2 mins walk from Fontana metro station which is just a few stops away from the city centre and other tourist spots. There is a supermarket about 5 mins walk away, turn left and left again as you're getting out of the hotel entrance. The only thing that bothered us was after sometime of the airconditioning being on our room gets filled with this digusting sewage smell and vanishes when we turn off the A/C. This happened twice and not sure if it's got to do with the A/C system or something. Overall great hotel and would recommend it to anyone visiting Barcelona. Good for families with children or elderly alike as there's a lift.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, helpful accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: IsraelTravelers
Reviews.Content: The people at the front desk were very friendly. Room was clean and quiet. The hotel was away from but quite accessible to the tourist sites. While the breakfast room was nice, clean and basic we only ate there once - thereafter we used the kitchenette and cooked in. The stove, pots and pans and fridge were clean and invited use. While not in the standard "tourist area" the Gracia is an attraction and so there is plenty to walk around, see and do. A short walk from the Fontana Metro station. Just walk out of the station, turn right and walk up the first street that you see on your left. The hotel is under the flags at the end of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price, good for families”
Reviews.Author: TOtraveller66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July and were very happy with our choice. It's very close to the Fontana metro station which will have you in Plaza Catalunya in 5 minutes. The hotel staff were very friendly and very helpful. No question was too much and no request was ignored. We chose this particular hotel because of the amenities it offers - we were travelling with our 5-year old and the room had a small kitchenette and a separate bed for him - not a sofabed but more like a day bed. After putting him to bed, we could go out to our private terrace for a glass of wine and not worry that we had to be quiet so that our child could get to sleep. The terrace was HUGE - twice the size of the room, easily. It didn't overlook anything more than other buildings (but they weren't right in front of you) but this also meant that it was quiet for sleeping. There are a number of restaurants, cafes and stores very close by over by Fontana metro. We ate breakfast in the hotel two out of three mornings (very standard European breakfast but you get to eat it outside in the garden, complete with astroturf!). There is also a cafebar just down the road which also serves breakfast at a more economical price. I would definitely stay here again! It's great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff & convenient location to Metro”
Reviews.Author: waverider
Reviews.Content: Big plus for us was the location convenience to the Metro since we traveled every day on it- so cheap & easy to get around & only 3 stops away from La Rambla action but quieter location here. Friendly staff, safe neighborhood, just was expecting a larger room from the photos. The room was adequate since we only slept there, but no ventilation fan in the bathroom & the tiny window does open to a shaft directly opposite another's window- kind of a strange remodeling job! Didn't buy the breakfast, but there was a small patio out back to sit. WIFI & safe in room is a plus. To us, the negative was they will not give you 2 keys for your room & you have to turn your key in & then ask for it each time you come & go. Partner & I went out together & came back separately a few times so I would have to go up to open my room, leave the door propped open, run back to turn the key in & then hurry back up to the room- so ridiculous & unneccessary.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Larry 69
Reviews.Content: The rooms aren't particularly large, but include a kitchenette suitable for eating-in and cooking, a decent size fridge, and utensils. Room rates are more than fair. The staff are extremely accommodating, cleanliness is obvious, and the location of the hotel, about a 2 minutewalk from the Metro, and around the corner from a wonderful Argentine restaurant, is most desirable. We did not purchase the hotel breakfasts, but rather shopped at the Carrefours supermercado near the Catalunya Metro stop for our own special waker-uppers. Larry Ross We'll surely return to the Silver whenever we get to Barcelona - the hotel actually makes our return more likely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way one can measure....”
Reviews.Author: NeesyL
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great value for your money. Very clean room with friendly/helpful staff. VERY close to the Metro and not in the tourist area (a plus.) Small kitchen where we cooked two nights out of the five we stayed at Aparthotel. Courtyard where breakfast was served and where you could sit and relax during the day was lovely, calm & quiet. FREE wifi and two computers in the lobby. Gracia neighborhood has local shops where you can pick up some great buys and the supermarkets are very inexpensive and handy. All because it is NOT in a tourist location. Barcelona is a fantastic city and public transportation is easy and inexpensive. Cons: Breakfast is extra, but at 8 euro/each, it was more than enough to get us through until 3 p.m. and convenient. Breakfast is not served until 7:45. Only two English-speaking channels on T.V. and they were both news - BBC and CNN.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel close metro station”
Reviews.Author: Taras13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Silver for 5 nights. It has good location - Gracia district, just 2 minutes away from Fontana metro station, shops, market and restaurants. Hotel reception staff very friendly and helpful. Room (#201) was clean, quite, with new furniture. Kitchenette was well equipped with all needed things. The price (76.75 euro/night) was a little bit high for me, but its difficult to find cheaper apart-hotel with good location in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the shopping district”
Reviews.Author: hkandiko
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. It was a great hotel for the price (breakfast extra). It was a nice, clean room, with TV and air and with friendly staff. There were two computers with free Internet. Information in the lobby with things to do. A few things I didn't like about the hotel was that it was not close to many places to eat. Nor was it close to attractions. Plenty of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice hotel & good location”
Reviews.Author: kakifok
Reviews.Content: The location is very close to Metro. And I like their wooden floor, it feels like home. My room has kitchen so I can cook sometimes. The price is reasonable and the reception staff are very helpful! I would like to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great find. Central enough and really close to Metro (200m).”
Reviews.Author: Robbos5556
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with attentive, friendly staff who assisted us on every respect. Adequate English spoken.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: SilviaOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the room look nice. The walls are way too thin and we could hear other people talking and snoring. There is a kitchen corner, good if you plan to stay for few days. The bathroom has a window so from the room you can see what's happening inside (!). Breakfast is not included and costs 8€. When you leave the room you have to give the keys to the reception which is open 24h and to access the hotel you have to ring: seems they are quite afraid that something bad can happen.

Reviews.Title: “Our home in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Simonetslsk
Reviews.Content: Five times me and my wife already stayed at the Aparthotel Silver. For us it's the only place to stay in Barcelona, because of it's location (Gràcia) it's reasonable price, the service and friendlyness of staff, the lay-out of the rooms et cetera. We prefer the comfort rooms because of the modern ameneties and decor. It seems the last two budget rooms will be refurbished soon. As mencioned before the hotel is well connected with the metro system so many tourist and shopping places are easy to go to. For a more real life experience check out the Vila de Gracia with it's many squares, restaurants and bars. It you want to make (full) use of the small kitchen there are three markets on walking distance from the hotel; Mercat de Galveny, Mercat de Libertad and Mercat de l'Abaceria Central.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: ovation802
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night when first arriving in Barcelona. The room was not ready for 2 hours after the check in time which was disappointing since we were exhausted from our overnight flight from the states. The did apologize and give us some delicious chocolates while we waited. The staff was friendly and the location is good. The room was a little less nice than I expected but over all would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Tahoeaw
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean & staff was friendly. But many of the rooms are situated in the center of the building which means they get no airflow. We were there in April and it was warm enough for A/C. But the A/C is a central system for the whole building and management decided it was not hot enough for the A/C. Opening the window didn't make much difference since they open out the the center cavity in the building. Some rooms may look out on the street, but most do not. Location is fine, very close to Metro. Overall, very average. Didn't partake in the breakfast, didn't look worth it..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: butterandjelly
Reviews.Content: My extended family (three generations) and I stayed at the Aparthotel Silver for one night on each end of a Mediterranean cruise trip. We found the hotel to be clean and comfortable with pleasant staff. It's conveniently located half a block from a Metro stop, though it is in the Gracia district, not in the major touristy places (but they're easy to get to). The breakfast was of good quality and variety. We all agreed that we'd happily stay here again if and when we return to Barcelona. One recommendation: ask for an inside room. On the second night (a Saturday), the street noise was loud enough to wake me and keep me awake.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice of hotel with helpful and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: carolsprky
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed here pre-cruise for four days and found it to be a great choice. I found the hotel on tripadvisor.com and it lived up to my expectations. Conveniently located near the Fontana metro stop, the staff were friendly and knowledgeable in offering suggestions on places to see and, more importantly, how to get there, even providing bang on directions from the airport. They were always willing to help with a smile. The room was compact, very clean and had everything we needed. The beds were a little too hard but the pillows were wonderful to snuggle into. The breakfast had a great selection and was great value for the money. We really enjoyed our stay here and highly recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome, helpful and friendly staff, a relaxing atmosphere, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: CandBSuffolk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights at the Aparthotel Silver. Great location for Gracia area and Gaudi sites and only a short walk from Fontana metro station so very easy to get around the whole city. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. The room was very clean and comfortable and overall great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_KateMKE
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right off the Fontana metro stop which was a huge convenience for us. It was so easy to find and it was nice not to have to walk far with our luggage. The staff was pleasant and I was impressed at their knowledge of different languages. The room and bathroom were a good size and the bed was comfortable. We were on the 1st floor so breakfast got a little noisy every morning, even through my ear plugs. The free wi-fi was a really nice touch and much appreciated. It was a little strange to have to turn in our key every time we left to the front desk. This hotel still uses a regular lock and key for their rooms. I understand the need to turn it into the front desk, but why don't they just upgrade to a credit card style key card like most hotels? The old fashioned key/lock door seemed pretty old school for how big of a city Barcelona is. Would've expected it more from a smaller city. As far as value, my friend and I travelled to Barcelona, Grenada, Seville, and Madrid. This hotel was by far the most expensive. Other hotels along the way were just as nice and just as close to all the action, so not sure why this one was so much more expensive. We could afford it, just more expensive than what I would've thought.

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities, but the actual hotel room left a little to be desired”
Reviews.Author: ktyg
Reviews.Content: Aparthotel Silver was our 4th and final hotel during our 2 week honeymoon in Spain. As I mentioned in other reviews, we were seeking value more than elegance in our accomodations and that led us to this hotel. All in all, this hotel had really distinct pros and cons. For example, one of the best things about this hotel is the free internet in the lobby. There are 2 computers that you can use (one with a printer too) any time of day. Additionally, the staff who work at the front desk were all incredibly friendly and helpful each time we had a question for them. Another highlight of the hotel was the patio area, which we discovered on our last evening. It's a nice little square area with a few tables - great for enjoying a bottle of wine in the sun. However, on the other side of the spectrum, our room was the most bland and unattractive space we had in all of Spain. (We stayed in room 105.) There was a window, but no natural light came in because the window fed out into a skylight-type area. Therefore the whole room was a dimly lit, dingy yellow-ish color, no matter the time of day. The dated cabinetry surrounding the bed and the orange & brown duvet did not help matters. It seems as though the rooms decor has not been updated since the 1970s. Our bath was tiny with no counter space for toiletries. Additionally the drain in our shower was clogged and despite reporting it to the front desk twice, it was not fixed during our stay. The kitchenette was an amenity that I was looking forward to having, but it turns out we only used the fridge for juice and fruit, so it wasn't worth really having it. Overall, this hotel was a bit disappointing. Perhaps we just got the oldest room and others are much nicer, but I would look for another location next time I travel to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel and a Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: william2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (both in our late 60s) stayed here for a week in early April 2011 at the conclusion of eight weeks independent travel in Spain and Portugal. We had saved the best, Barcelona, for last and neither the hotel nor Barcelona disappointed. We thought the hotel was very solid, and that it provided a very good value, especially in expensive Barcelonia. Staff were professional, courteous, friendly, and always helpful, and staff along with location are the strongest aspects of this hotel. We ran into several British couples who were repeat visitors to both Barcelona and to the hotel. We loved the location both for its one minute walk to the Fontana metro station and because it is part of the Gracia -- we loved the pedestrian only streets of the Gracia, enjoyed wandering this fascinating neighborhood, and stopping at cafes and bars day or night. The Gracia is our kind of "hood." Our room in the hotel was spacious, located on the first floor patio level, and was very quiet -- the "Q" word is the supreme criterion for us when evaluating a hotel. We did not spend a lot of time in the hotel -- who would with Barcelona calling? A day or two in I purchased an FCB tee shirt and hat -- hotel staff noticed immediately noticed and gave a thumbs up. I want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value, fine staff”
Reviews.Author: cycleprof
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very good value. It's very close to the metro stop which means you have easy access to all of Barcelona. Hotel is very secure. Staff is extremely cordial. The rooms are simple-we had a terrace room which I would recommend. Our room faced the street which can be a bit noisy, but we closed the shutters to sleep and it was no problem. Beds are comfortable and wifi works well, but the rooms lack adequate leisure seating. Everything is kept very clean and the efficiency kitchen lets you do a lot of simple food prep. Plenty of hot water. We were able to eat breakfast in the room (don't think the breakfast buffet they offer for 8euro is a good value) and also put together lunch on the go. There are numerous shops, groceries,atms and restaurants in easy walking distance and you can walk down to the Diagonal Area (La Pedrera) in about 10 minutes. Would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “good value, clean, lovely quiet area - great base for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: shropsmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2-nights in April. The staff were very efficient and friendly, answering any questions we had. The 'comfort' room was clean and modern, with a small kitchen area, flat screen TV and wi-fi. Transport links were great with the metro station very near and a short walk to Parc Guell, which is a must see. The hotel is located within the quiet upper part of the Gracia district which is full of designer shops and lovely restaurants. On our day of departure, we had to check out by 11am and as our flight didnt leave untill 7pm, the hotel were more than happy to look after our luggage for the day, to prevent lugging it around all day.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Barcelona. Ticked all the boxes.”
Reviews.Author: daveyesdave
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. I stayed for a total of 9 nights in 3 separate rooms - that was my doing as I came and went a couple of times to nearby towns - and each room and stay was excellent. The room with a balcony was probably the most dated (408), but rooms 208 and 205 were both newly renovated with good quality finishes. Room 205 is at the back of the building and is quieter than the others, which were a little noisy due to some traffic noise. Great little kitchenette, fantastic bathroom and exceptionally clean. Oh, and the staff are fantastic. Very helpful and friendly. And I really liked the location of Gracia, which is still close to everything, but away from the main touristy areas which I prefer as I HATE being in the middle of the touristy areas. You get a more authentic Barcelona experience here as you can shop, eat and drink with the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Seth764
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a budget room on the 1st level which had a little kitchenette, tv with CNN and was quiet at night. The hotel safe was also handy to stored away valybles. Breakfast was really good value for 8 euros and lady that worked in there very friendly. Internet kiosk in the foyer was helpful when I needed to check e-mails. Definitely good place to stay and metro just round the corner. Beware of pick pocketers though in Metro area!! I was robbed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, could not fault it!”
Reviews.Author: Pollyputthekettleon
Reviews.Content: Very good location for visiting Barcelona, we could walk to all the sights. Room very clean and good condition. Bed's new and good quality. Breakfast excellent with plenty of choice and very good quality for the money. If not sure where to stay then choose here! We ummed and arred but my brother recommended it and so we went for it, so glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: p6403240
Reviews.Content: Great aparment, good location within easy walk to mero and supermarket (3-5 min.). Staff was very-very friendly and usefull. The room was a good size and well furnished. Kitchen is very well equiped (even olive oil, salt, sponge...). I can thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable relation between price and quality”
Reviews.Author: Christian021
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff always ready to help, superb rooms, affordable breakfast but you can also prepare your own meals and there is a supermarket just round the corner opposite the metro station that is a remarkable 100 meters away and only two stops from Plaza Catalunya. The hotel is a great place to use as a base for exploring the city but is a quite place to rest compared to hotels located near the Rambla. Also, don't forget to explore the Gracía quarter - a lot of charming squares located in the maze like area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location clean and convenient for underground to all the sights.”
Reviews.Author: manizzle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last weekend and it had kitchenette included! It was close to the metro so we were able to get to all the sights quickly and cheaply.the hotel was clean had free wifi and the staff were very hepfull. Came home after 12 one night so be prepared to ring the bell to open the iron gates. However saying all that we had a lovely time and would definitely go back again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: phatbear
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay at the apartsilver hotel and it was a great stay. Location is ideal, if you are arriving from BCN airport then get the aerobus to placa catlayuna then jump on the metro to fontana and the hotel is a 2 min walk from there. There are plenty of "local" bars for food and drink. Rooms are well laid out and everything you could need is in the room, including a fridge a safe and free wifi, which are important in our hotel choice. Only minor criticism's are the lack of english tv channels in the rooms, but its spain so what would you expect, and the wooden floors were a tad dusty. On our next trip to Barcelona the aparthotel will be our 1st choice of hotel

Reviews.Title: “very good choice for longer stays”
Reviews.Author: maza17
Reviews.Content: I was moving here from a four star, fancier hotel and I can fairly say I felt better here. The staff, as it has been said, is very friendly and helpful (and in the hotel booklet they actually encourage you to ask their help for anything including restaurant reservations, car rentals etc.). The location is just perfect for breakfast with coffee&muffins at local cafes and nights with tapas in small restaurants (we particularly enjoyed Joali in Placa del Sol and Tapa i Apat on Gran Gracia). We didn't used the hotel restaurant, though. The room is rather small indeed and the bathroom is not really modern, but everything is very functional, and clean and you don't get to spend much time in the room anyway...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Spot”
Reviews.Author: Shazzab21
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for a stay in Barcelona - just north of the really touristy areas but within walking distance.Really helpful Staff & the kitchenette in the room was great as we were coming to the end of a 7 week trip it was nice to be able to make your own dinner for a change!!! Supplies easily purchased around this more residential area.The bar down the road towards Fontana Station had lovely cold beer & great Tapas. once I got over cooking!!!! Great Value, ideal location, friendly Staff what more do you need? Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “No better play to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: solo_trvlr15
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a superior room (601) from Oct. 14-19 and had a fantastic stay. The hotel itself is located less than a minute walk from Fontana station in Gracia and near Mercat Llibertat, so it was easy to purchase groceries and prepare some meals in the room's well-equipped kitchenette. The room was kept very clean and the hotel's facilities are well-maintained. I loved having the private balcony to enjoy the sunrises. But the best part of my stay was the the exceptional customer service. My wallet was stolen my first day in Barcelona and throughout my ordeal the hotel staff bent over backwards to help me deal with the local police and the credit card companies. They even offered to take my stay on credit and allow me to pay when I returned home because of the problems I was having getting my emergency replacement credit card to work. I simply can't say enough great things about the hotel, its location and staff and if I were to ever return to Barcelona, I would stay at the Silver Hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: adelantecs
Reviews.Content: 1 block away from the subway stop, easy access to all of the major attractions in Barcelona. Small kitchenette was great, free wi-fi in room and computers for free use in lobby. free use of the safe deposit box in the room. Traveled with my 70 year old mother and 40 some year old sister and the location was great. Staff was extremely friendly. Even got a knock on our door because we weren't picking up the phone for our wake up call. Would go back again. Just keep in mind this is not a luxury hotel but if your plan is to have easy access to the city and be out and about and just come back to a safe and clean place to spend the nite this is your spot.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay...”
Reviews.Author: MadeiraIsland
Reviews.Content: Been recently to this very good hotel and very happy with our choice. Everything well organized. We booked a Superior room, large room,big balcony and all the facilities very good. Also very clean. This hotel is very special. Very good location,and the Fontana Metro is just at the end of the street making perfect connections to the beautiful city of Barcelona. The Staff of the Hotel are PERFECT.They always help you with a smile and always very attentive.Dafne,Assumpta,Miguel,Carlos,Antonia...and all the others i cannot remember their names,thank you all for making our stay so perfect. In the future we shall return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Calm and well organized hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MacKosh
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is a little bit out of the city center but ca. 30 minutes walk takes you to Placa de Catalunya. We walked down there every morning and it was not a major issue for us. If want to take metro, Fontana stations is just within 2 - 3 minutes walking distance. Our room is not spacious but enough for two people and everything, kitchen, shower, closet , etc. is well organized and easy to use. Hotel staff is friendly, they kindly answer your questions and all of them speak decent English. I love staying this hotel and I will come back there when I need to stay in Barcelona in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CMEGo11
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently spent 9 days in Barcelona and stayed here. It was a great deal. We loved having the convenience of having the small kithcenette in our room. There were a number of stores and markets near by to shop for food. One of the main reasons I loved staying here was the location. It felt like a safe neighborhood and was close to the metro stop. We didn't have any problem finding our way to any of the sites we wanted to visit. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean. It was nice having access to the internet in the lobby. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: geraldchua
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the comfort room (twin beds) with kitchenette for 74 euro per night. Extremely value for money. Rooms are clean & comfortable. Amenities are adequate. Safe is available in room as well. Hotel is close to metro station, easy to access to tourist attractions, train stations & major shopping districts. Nearby, there is a supermarket. Safe neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, fantastic staff and excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: Peacheh
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner have just arrived home from our second stay at the Aparthotel Silver in Barcelona's Gracia area. We first stayed here in September 2007 and found the staff just as wonderful then as we did this time. Since our last stay the rooms appear to have been given a revamp and they look fantastic. Our room overlooked the lovely garden where you can eat your breakfast or just relax in peace. The room had tasteful decor, a flatscreen tv, a stereo, an incredibly comfy bed, kitchenette with fridge and cooker and cutlery, and a good sized bathroom with an excellent power shower. The location of the hotel is excellent. The Gracia district has many little restaurants and bars that are much cheaper than the Ramblas and, we found, often of a much higher quality. We would recommend Bo restaurant for beers and tapas! Our idea of hell would be staying somewhere directly on the Ramblas with its noise and drunken tourists. This hotel is a minute's walk from Fontana metro station and then it will take you less than 5 minutes to reach Catalunya station which is at the top of the Ramblas. The metro stations are incredibly warm but the trains are fantastically frequent. It is €1.40 for a single ticket one way. Should you choose to get a taxi from the hotel to the Ramblas or vice versa, it will cost you around €7. The staff in this hotel are fantastic. They are so friendly and helpful and efficient. Special mention has to go to the gentleman that mans reception at night time. Always smiling and happy to help with anything, even when you're a little tipsy! The hotel also provides a secure place to leave your bags for the day once you check out (which we utilised yesterday as we didnt need to be at the airport until 8pm). All in all this is a wonderful hotel and I would recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: happy-trails23
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Aparthotel Silver. It's well situated if you want to be a short distance from the noisy and tourist-heavy areas--about a 20-25-minute walk or 5 minute metro ride to the Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas. We enjoyed walking this because you pass some fantastic sights, including Casa Mila (La Pedrera), Casa Battlo, and many other beautiful modernist buildings. We also walked to Sagrada Familia very easily. The metro stop was just a block or so away, as was a supermarket. There are lots of great restaurants and bars nearby. The room was clean and nice, with a great little kitchenette that we made good use of. Our room faced a small inner courtyard so we did not really have any kind of view or much natural light, which we were a little sad about, but perhaps because of this, the room was exceptionally quiet, which was nice. The staff was friendly and spoke English well, and the computer in the lobby was very useful. We would definitely recommend this hotel based on value, location, and quality if you're looking for a nice, affordable room with a kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: pspjenn
Reviews.Content: We reserved our room after our initial hotel had to cancel our reservation because of renovations. We weren't sure what to expect as I hadn't researched the hotel as extensively. I was pleasently suprised that it was a very nice hotel, nice staff, and good location. We had a room on the first floor. The room was a good bargain for location, cleanliness, etc. The staff was very pleasant and helpful with restaurant recommendations. We also had access to the internet in the lobby which was always available when we needed it. The air conditioner worked great and it was a nice suprise to get chocolates in our room that were very yummy. This hotel is a block away from the metro station which made it handy for navigating Barcelona. I also enjoyed the restaurants and liviliness in the Gracia area. Lastly, it was raining while we were there and it was great that the hotel allowed you to use their complimentary umbrellas. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, so we cannot comment on the quality/price of this.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Fai_MYS
Reviews.Content: I had my city break with my gf in Barcelona in June. It was a lovely trip and Barcelona is beautiful. I will recommend this hotel to everyone I know even my own family member. First of all, let's talk about the cleanliness of this hotel, 5 STAR!!! it is very clean, wooden floor, toilet, wall, bed, and many more, 5 STAR Clean! Secondly, location!! Extremely near to the metro station (Fontana). Only 3 stops away from the famous street Las Ramblas!!! Third, staff. very friendly and helpful. However, their english is not so good. Be smart when communicate with them. Try to use your body language. Fourth, Price. Very reasonable, especially for couples or family. In the hotel, they have a small kitchen for you. All appliances are provided. Fifth, Facilities. Wifi is provide for free. If you didnt bring a laptop, they got a computer at the lobby and you can use it for free. they borrow you an umbrella if the weather is not so good. Lastly, I hope you can enjoy your trip in Barcelona. This hotel is your best choice!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite hotel anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: lambiegroup
Reviews.Content: We travel alot and hotel silver is our favorite hotel anwhere! it makes us all the more eager to return to barcelona! we've stayed at the hotel silver twice now, and will never even think of another hotel in barcelona! the value is terrific. the rooms are great. the staff are personable and very efficient, and fun! the location is super, a block from a metro stop. great job, hotel silver!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: vassa76
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel in the area of Gracia in the 3-minute walk from the metro station "Fonatana". For 15-20 minutes step walk to the Park Guell and the famous Gaudi building La Pedre. The hotel is very friendly and friendly staff. It was a pleasant surprise - a box of chocolates as a gift from the hotel. We arrived late at night and we needed water. Our reception staff kindly gave it to us. On the day of departure, we called a taxi at 5:00 am. I highly recommend a room with a terrace on the south side. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & very pleasant helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sarah3531
Reviews.Content: Went with my mother, aunt and a family friend. My mother and I had a twin room overlooking the street entrance. Was a bit noisy but was fine once the windows and shutter was closed and we slept ok, although it was a bit stuffy. Our two other friends had a twin room in the centre of the hotel which has windows but there did not seem to be any air circulating (windows seemed to open to an atrium) and so their room was extremely stuffy so I'd recommend requesting rooms with windows which open up to the outside open air. The kitchenette was very handy as well. We found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful, from reception staff to the cleaners and cafe staff. The reception staff had good English. The location and the room itself we found to be great at the price we paid. I think it took us about 45 mins at a very leisurely pace to walk to Catalunya Square - quite a bit of stop/starting with photographing, windowshopping and browsing etc along the way. The Fontana metro station is just a few minutes up the road from the hotel and Catalunya Square is only 3 stops away. A taxi from the airport to the hotel cost around €30, this was for 4 people with 4 suitcases. A taxi to Catalunya Square was around €7. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends that are looking for a nice hotel in a great location and would not hesitate in booking this hotel again (as long as we can have a similarly located room).. This is not a luxury accomodation but for a base and a place to make a snack, come back from a days sightseeing / walking or whatever, have a rest and a chat and a drink before going out again, shower and sleep it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: anthro101
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona March 12-18. We stayed nearly the entire time at the Silver Hotel. We enjoyed our stay very much both in Barcelona and at the Hotel Silver. The amenities were fine, wireless Internet in the rooms, cable TV, small kitchenette, decent bathroom and shower. The location, as others have noted, is perhaps the best one could find, for the price. It is just a block to the Metro and is in the middle of every kind of eating establishment area you could ever need from microwaveable foods to expensive restaurants. It is also walking distance to La Pedrera and Casa Batlo, and Barcelona's Fifth Avenue. The area near the Hotel (Gracia) has lots of small narrow streets that make this area very comfortable and enjoyable for sightseeing walks. The only negative about the hotel is the thinness of the walls separating rooms. We had a back room (opposite to the street) and that saved us from any street noise, but one could still hear people talking in adjacent rooms, even their snoring. But, I believe all the other good qualities make up for this deficiency. No place is perfect. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. We would stay there again if we go back. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms, awful noise”
Reviews.Author: rocsBucharest
Reviews.Content: We were 2 couples staying at Silver Hotel for the New Year eve and a few more days after. We found the hotel very well located, just a few steps from the metro line 3 and a 20 minutes walk to Paseig de Gracia. Rooms were modern, nice and clean. However, 2 big minuses: 1. the noise is awful, I could not get any sleep without ear plugs, there practically no sound proof from the street and the inner walls are thin enough to hear your neighbours if they talk loud. Our friends asked for a room with a window on the back of the hotel and it was better, however the noise from other rooms is still disturbing. 2. if you are > than 1.80 m tall we may find the bed short enough. Breakfast was not included in the room price, there was an option to 7 euros, but the offer was very poor so we ate at the hoteljust once. Another peculiarity: the bathroom had a window to the room that had a transparent blind, so if you are not travelling as a couple, this could be unpleasant. Otherwise, Reception people very nice and helpful, free internet acces. At 99 euro per night during the New Year celebration we found the price a bit too high.

Reviews.Title: “incredibely friendly and ideally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: hazzardgirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find, simply get on the green line on the underground get off at Fontana and go down the side street directly across the road from the stop. The staff were FANTASTIC, so friendly, the rooms are a little dated but very clean (ask for the spacious rooms) and have a kitchenette with plenty of tea, coffee, sugar, cloths etc.the spacious rooms also have a microwave. There is a supermarket on the corner where you can get milk and bread and plenty of pastisseries in the area. There is a garden at the back of the hotel where you can eat or have a few glasses of wine. Free WIFI, adaptors, umbrellas - they dont seem to be after every penny you have. the staff are more than willing to help with anything you need. The area is nice and quiet and seemed very safe, lots of little boutiques and quirky shops and its only 3 stops from Placya de Catalunya on the metro. Would definately stay there again. Try the Tapas bar a few doors up

Reviews.Title: “Modern, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Cathybo
Reviews.Content: One block away from a metro station. Buffet breakfast for a moderate price. Very clean ans spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “well located, very friendly staff, price/quality okay”
Reviews.Author: Onlyanick
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel end of september, we had the "comfort room with terrace". Bath was small and rather worn, but room size was okay (we stayed only 3 nights and used the room exclusivley to sleep). The terrace looked not as nice as on the hotel website - fotos must have been made from room and terrace when all was really new. But nevertheless, I would return to this hotel, because it gave us all we needed: friendly staff, free internet in the lobby and excellent location. Metro is only some steps away, the barrio is safe, beds were clean, Everything was clean. By the way: the body lotion of the hotel (which I usually do not try) was lovely - nice smell, nice feeling. For those, who want to visit Barcelona and do not have many days to see "all", I can recommend taking the "bus turístic" (open top double decker bus) with audioguides in 10 languages. You nearly need no tickets for the metro and can see a lot of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: BonoGirl_BC
Reviews.Content: The Aparthotel Silver is a charming hotel a stone's throw away from the Fontana metro station (a very good Metro line). My friend and I were able to book a double room at a discounted rate of approximately 64 euros a night. It was very spacious and comfortable, with a couch, a flat screen TV, and a safe in the closet. There was of course a kitchenette, but since we were always out and about, we only just used the fridge. My only complaints about our room: 1. The airconditioner wasn't working properly. Even when it was cranked up, the room felt warm. 2. The water from the shower kept dripping from the ledge of the tub on to the floor, so there was always a puddle. But we always came back to a clean bathroom with a dry floor and lots of towels. As others have mentioned, the one computer terminal in the lobby was always occupied. We did manage to use it on our last night to check-in online for our flights. I would remind others who do this to delete the history and cookies. We realized that one could easily have gone in to see our flight information just by scrolling down the URL field. The hotel is in a great location - quiet and residential, but not that far removed from the action (others prefer staying in the Ramblas; I found that area too chaotic for my liking). There is a supermarket on the next street and several wonderful restaurants nearby, including "TAPA i APAT", where we had the best mixed paella. Gaudí's Casa Vicens is about a five minute walk away. The staff were excellent. The ladies at the front desk were warm and welcoming and spoke English (and several other languages!) very well. The housekeeping staff always greeted us with a smile and "Hola" or "Bon dia" every morning. All in all, I was very pleased with our stay at this hotel. I wouldn't hesitate staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, best quality/price ratio!”
Reviews.Author: ciba
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Aparthotel Silver in Barcelona from 10 to 15 of June, 2009, with my girlfriend and we loved it! The staff is very friendly and helpfull. The location is just a 2 min. walk from the metro station (Fontana, L3, green line). Its a quiet neighbourhood, with some bars, although we preferred those on Las Ramblas and close to the Port. The room has a lot of space, modern look and new with a kitchnette within a closet. The bathroom not so spacious but still was very clean and new. As to the general cleaning of the room we don't have any complaints. Definitly worthwile, specially if you want to save some money on the accomodation side. We recomend it and we'll stay there again when we come back to Barcelona. A very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: amarty1
Reviews.Content: What a nice little place! We arrived too early to check in, but the very courteous and helpful (and completely fluent in English) staff kept our luggage locked for us until we could check in. The rooms are a fairly comfortable size and there is an entire kitchen behind a closet door! We did not pay for the hotel's breakfast, as we were able to store food in the room's kitchen (there is a grocery store around the corner). Bathrooms are very clean and modern, though on the small side. My only complaint is that our room looked onto a little courtyard--while quiet, I would have preferred a view of the street. The hotel is located in a quiet residential area, but there are still lots of shops around (similar to if you stayed on the Upper West Side of NYC), and the hotel is just one block away from the L3 metro line, just a handful of stops from the center of the city and other metro lines. There is also free internet in the lobby, which was a huge plus. We overslept past check out time the day we were to leave, but the staff was very understanding and did not charge us for another day. While it isn't in center city, the quiet and ease of the metro make this a great find at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to downtown, but in a residential neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: debdebdeb80
Reviews.Content: Aparthotel Silver is only a 10 minute metro ride from downtown Barcelona, but is located in a residential neighborhood full of shops and people. Wandering the nearby backstreets gives one a real feel for life in Barcelona. A 15 minute walk will take you to a food market filled with stands selling fruit, vegetables, fish, cheese, meats, tapas, and baked goods. There is a 9 screen cinema around the corner and a laundromat a 10 minute walk away. Several restaurants and numerous tapas bars are within a 1 kilometer walk. The hotel has a breakfast we never tried because there are numerous bakeries, fromageries, and fruit stands within 2 blocks. Each morning while my daughter showered, I strolled out and bought a delicious breakfast which we ate on our terrace. (Only the top floor rooms have a terrace.) The room had a kitchenette, so we could store our extra food in the fridge and eat off real plates. The air conditioning was effective and the shower was the biggest we'd had on the entire trip. While the decor was simple and spartan, the rooms were quiet and the beds comfortable. The hotel made a great home base for exploring Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Jevinlondon
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is a relatively small and easy to get around city. Thus, staying at this hotel is definitely a good choice as compared to staying at hotels in/near the La Ramblas area. I recommend that people should book directly with hotels not only for better rates, but as well as direct communications with hotel. This was true in my case. I got on to their website and they have a promotion rate of almost half price for a double/twin room. As I was travelling with family of 6, including 2 elderly and 1 young child, I also request for a connecting room which I got it, which is only applicable to the comfort room and I also stress that comfort room is the best choice as it is refurbished and definitely looks classier and comfortable than the lower room categories, at not very much difference. Now, back to the hotel itself, location perfect, near to Fontana Station, the first traffic light on your right upon exiting the station, cross over and walk along the narrow street and you will find the hotel. It's location is quiet but feels safe, and is Barcelona, of course, you got to be careful everywhere. Not only it is close to station, nearby hotel there are late night shops, a few small eateries as well as one supermarket (closes 9pm). As for the room, the most delightful about the comfort room I booked, was the fact that it had a mini kitchen, thus if you like to make a simple meal, it is perfect, not to mention the extra touches like microwave, sink, mini dining table, you will not even get it in 4-5 star hotels. The bathroom is not so big and has showers only but not a problem for us as my family members are small-sized people, so one point to look out for those people wanting huge space. Staff was helpful and friendly. There is even a computer for Internet surfing at the lobby for guest to use for free. The only problem (not hotel's fault) was that some guests using the computer tends to hog on it for hours and thus, if you are reading this and thinking of booking this hotel, may I suggest a common simple courtesy to restrict usage of the computer to maximum 30 minutes. I was a little irritated by 2 middle-aged ladies who used the computer for more than 3 hours when I came down a few times to try to use it. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to those with middle budget and am looking for comfort and space. I am also glad to have use tripadvisor to get reviews when I make my decision to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoveSun901
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in January with my boyfriend and was very happy with it. It is in a brilliant location and we could not believe how easy it was to find, it is a 1min walk from the metro station!! The staff were quite helpful, but would not go out of their way to help you. The room was a little bit old fashioned but had a lovely bathroom with a large bath. It also had a very useful kitchenette where it was nice to store cool water and snacks ! Overall I though this was very good value for money and in a perfect location, I would have no hesitation in returning or recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous hotel - Just love it!”
Reviews.Author: LvYouZhe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights on 9 Apr 09. Was received warmly at the reception desk upon arrival. That was a good start. The room has all the necessary amenities. Liked the idea of having a small stove where we could cook some noodles to cut down the expenses of dining outside. The cleaning maid did a good job in cleaning up the room daily. One downside was the air-con which was not cold enough but it did not affect us much considering the cold weather outside. It was a short distance on foot from Fontana station. Cross the traffic light when you are outside the metro station. And bingo, you will not fail to miss the hotel with the flags flying outside it. We booked the hotel directly from its website - www.hotelsilver.com.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment hotel with excellent service close to city center in residential area”
Reviews.Author: besj62
Reviews.Content: Aparthotel Silver is an apartment hotel (fridge and kitchenette) just about 20 minutes walk from Plaza de Catalunya. It is situated in Gracia which is an area where middle class Barceloneans live, shop and eat. I stayed here for the third time, this time with my children (16 and 18 years old). One of my children is disabled and we had asked for a roomwith disabled access. We got that confirmed and the room was excellent. When my daughters wheelchair had a flat tire the people at the hotel repaired it for us. they did not even charge us for it (I would not have argued...). Excellent service! Also the hotel is placed really well if you prefer to stay off the real hot places, although you can easily crawl back from the Ramblas late in the morning...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: giveitagonow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a four day visit to Barcelona. The taxi driver knew exactly where this hotel was. The gentleman at the front desk when we checked in late in the evening spoke very little English but was patient with my Spanish and was very helpful. The daytime front desk clerk was fluent in English and also very helpful. There were lots of tourist brochures in the lobby as well as newspapers/weeklies in Spanish and English. We stayed in one of the older rooms (the hotel was undergoing renovations), but found it - although a tad shabby - very clean and comfortable. Our window looked out into a nice little courtyard. We were worried about late night noise but luckily it was very quiet in the evenings the entire time we stayed there. First, some bad things: When we booked online we read that the hotel has laundry service, which we thought meant there was a laundry room on the premises. Turns out that it's actually a "send out" type service you pay extra for - you put your laundry in a provided plastic bag and leave it for the cleaning service to take care of for you. The price was a little unreasonable and we didn't like that too much. If you need to do laundry, there is a laundromat (in Spanish, a lavanderia) a reasonable walk away from the hotel: Bugaderia Wash n'Dry on Carrer Torrent De l'Olla. Google Map it to see where it is exactly. We also didn't like that you had to pay for wi fi service. There's free internet at a public computer in the lobby, but every time we went downstairs in the evening, someone was always on. Now the good: For about an extra 10 Euros a night, you can have breakfast buffet included during your stay. This was one of the best things about the hotel, as we expected a simple continental type breakfast (pastries, cafe con leche, and fruit), but when we came down to the cafe the first morning, we were very pleasantly surprised. Although there were no hot items, there was a plethora of yummy things like breads, cereal, coffee, tea, juices, cheeses and meats. Definitely worth the extra money. If you're trying to save a little, you can load up on breakfast and have a light lunch or quick, inexpensive tapa during the afternoon. There's also a mini fridge in the room if you want to buy food at a store. The hotel is in a great location in the Gracia district, literally one block up from the Fontana station and so it was easy to get everywhere in the city. All in all, a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hegx
